text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

You have all traveled
so far to get here.

We welcomed you with a hurricane
just to top it all off.
We are so glad you are here.

I want you all to be
fabulously successful.

The ambition, the talent you
bring to this place, go for it.

But it's in the broader
service of the public good.
That's what this place is about.

In our current
nomenclature, it's

leaders who make a
difference in the world.

And there is no doubt
that right now we

have a world that's in need of
difference, in need of change,
in need of repair.

Will business make that
positive difference?

It all hinges on the
actions of business leaders,

and particularly voices of
future business leaders.
And yes, I am looking at you.
I'm looking to you.

So here, we are aiming
to develop a new--

the knowledge, the
skills, and the values

that will help you become
the most effective leaders

and general managers
who have the vision

to see future opportunities,
set a direction

for the organization
or enterprise,

and inspire others to
achieve that vision.

One of the great benefits
of a case method education

is that you can hone your
ability to ask good questions,

and that is a
fundamental leadership
skill, asking questions.

The classroom is a deeply
collaborative place.

I can assure you that you will
improve your own learning.

But there'll be other areas
where you are still developing.
Ask for help.

Hang out with folks who are
different from you and treasure

when they surprise you
and disagree with you.
That is where the magic happens.

I believe you will see such
tremendously new opportunities

as you leave the
School, in a world that

will be very different
from the world you
left when you came here.

And so I hope over
the next two years,

you will use your
time here to build

these transformative
leadership skills.

And as you do so, never
forget the basics.

Be humble, be grateful, don't
forget to hold the door open

for others, and take every
opportunity to create purpose

and meaning in yours
and others' lives.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
